channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Scott Darlow has a brooding new single out next week: You Can't See Black In The Dark.
item.title: He was handed a knock-off Gibson on tour and 'this song just fell out'

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A toddler at a childcare centre in Parkville, plus a man who attended Saturday's Black Lives Matter protest in Melbourne are among Victoria's new COVID-19 cases.
item.title: Black Lives Matter protester in Melbourne tests positive for COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Perth Mint, owned by the state government, has bought hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of "conflict gold" in breach of its ethical policy.
item.title: Perth Mint gets its gold from company owned by killer and using child labour: reports

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 413,000 and there are more than 7.3 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Melbourne Black Lives Matter protest attendee contracts COVID-19 as NSW rolls back restrictions, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: Essendon’s Brandon Zerk-Thatcher is the first AFL player banned for breaking coronavirus protocols as Port Adelaide wait for the AFL decision on Ollie Wines.
item.title: Essendon player suspended, Port appeal for leniency on Wines' breach

item.description: Peter Weiss helped engender a culture of giving.
item.title: Fashion guru also great benefactor to the arts

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Australians have used the lockdown to gamble away their time and money, but there are emerging signs people are returning to cafes and restaurants.
item.title: Gambling spending up 50 per cent in the time of COVID

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Premier Mark McGowan is urging anti-racism protesters to cancel a rally planned in Perth on the weekend until the coronavirus pandemic is over.
item.title: WA Premier defends Health Minister and urges Black Lives Matter protest to be cancelled

item.description: Playmaker says the Cowboys will not be losing any sleep if Taumalolo is again sidelined by his injury.
item.title: Cowboys no one-man band: Drinkwater

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.description: His official visit marks the sixth anniversary of the terror group's onslaught in Iraq and comes amid its feared resurgence.
item.title: In the heart of IS's would-be caliphate, PM vows history won't repeat

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland is set to open its interstate borders in a month's time unless there are massive outbreaks of COVID-19 following the weekend protests.
item.title: Queensland 'looking good' for July border opening

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Lord mayor Adrian Schrinner has on Thursday confirmed Brisbane City Council wants to be a joint purchaser of heritage-listed Lamb House on Kangaroo Point.
item.title: Brisbane City Council wants to jointly buy Lamb House

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The NSW government’s handling of the controversial CBD light rail construction has been savaged by the Auditor-General.
item.title: NSW government failed to update public on true cost of light rail

item.description: We've got a rundown of everything you need to know for the nine games coming up this weekend.
item.title: Round two preview: Everything you need to know ahead of football's return

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The regional air operator is expanding its fleet by about half as it aims to grow its share of the charter flight market and fill a void left by Virgin Australia.
item.title: Alliance Aviation readies to buy 20 planes to fill Virgin void

item.description: The Suns had the unusual experience of sharing their training base on Wednesday as West Coast descended on Metricon Stadium.
item.title: Suns welcome chance to show wares to AFL

item.description: The US has been asked to lobby Saudi Arabia for the release of a former Saudi official's children who were allegedly abducted in an internal power struggle.
item.title: Saudi family lobby US to help release 'kidnapped' children

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Historian and author Bruce Pascoe says there was slavery in Australia post-colonisation, and Scott Morrison saying otherwise is "an insult".
item.title: 'It's just denial': Bruce Pascoe, Labor condemn PM's 'no slavery in Australia' claim

item.description: It seems that like diet, exercise, and sleep, sex is now becoming an area of self-improvement too.
item.title: So you want to enhance your sex life? There's an app for that

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: NSW Police Commissioner Mick Fuller said police would be challenging an application to host a protest on Saturday which they believe will exceed 500 people and likely infringe social distancing guidelines.
item.title: NSW Police to take Sydney protest organisers to court ahead of event planned for weekend

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: The host of Amazon Prime Video's latest Australian production just wants to use her star power for the local good.
item.title: 'Every successful Australian feels that': Rebel Wilson on being tall-poppied

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The Fed poured cold water on hopes of a "V-shaped" economic recovery for the US as it delivered a bleak outlook. And the markets yawned.
item.title: The Fed just signalled why markets are so disconnected from economic reality

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: The star midfielder has not played since his left knee gave way last April against Geelong but is set to face North Melbourne on Sunday.
item.title: 'You thoroughly deserve to be back': Ward to make return from knee injury

item.description: The COVID-19 crisis has underlined the urgent need for superannuation funds to consolidate, with some funds' focus on hard-hit industries making them particularly vulnerable, the government argues.
item.title: Coronavirus exposes 'systemic risk' in Australia's super funds

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Scott Morrison has blasted Victoria's Belt and Road Initiative agreement with China, saying it is against Australia's national interest.
item.title: 'Inconsistent with foreign policy': Morrison urges Victoria to scrap BRI deal

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: From Brahms to new songs by Kim Salmon and the Surrealists, jump online for live music this weekend.
item.title: Kim Salmon is streaming: plus more online music this weekend

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: There are practical steps you can take to protect yourself from the coronavirus and avoid saliva droplets that can travel six metres in just five seconds.
item.title: Germy gyms: How to safely work out and avoid people's saliva droplets

item.description: Scientists have uncovered an unlikely way to boost coral health to help it withstand times of heat stress - a good dose of probiotic bacteria.
item.title: Probiotic bacteria could save coral reefs

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The new distribution centre is expected to be operational by the end of the year under fast-tracked COVID-19 recovery plans.
item.title: Amazon expands into Queensland with new multimillion-dollar hub

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Cats champion Patrick Dangerfield said it's incumbent on Australians to educate themselves about the land on which they stand and its importance to Indigenous people.
item.title: Cats plan to show support for Black Lives Matter movement

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Presidential candidate Joe Biden has pledged to pick a woman as his running mate – but who? And why will his choice be critical in this year's big election?
item.title: ‘A ticket to the presidency’: Why Joe Biden’s VP pick is so important

item.dc:creator: Alice Clarke
item.description: Unless you have a dedicated listening space and lots of time for music, you probably don't need a $10,000 plus setup.
item.title: High-end audio isn't always the best choice, but it can be stunning

item.description: The Western Bulldogs have had three months to stew on their round-one disaster and coach Luke Beveridge has promised to wield the axe at selection.
item.title: Dogs to get brutal at selection after stewing over first-round debacle

item.description: The fire in Spike Lee's belly continues to burn as brightly as ever.
item.title: Spike Lee in tumultuous times: 'I'm built for this'

item.description: An hours-long search of downtown Paso Robles ended without an arrest. Officials planned to release a sketch of the suspect.
item.title: California deputy shot in 'ambush' attack at police station

item.description: One of Europe's most-recognised asset managers says there's an 80 per cent chance a vaccine to prevent COVID-19 will arrive later this year, a key development that could presage a recovery for the global economy.
item.title: $330b wealth manager bets on coronavirus vaccine before year-end

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Clubs should set their sights on winning at least 10 games in this shortened 17-game season if they want to be guaranteed a spot in the finals in 2020. This is why.
item.title: Why 10 is the magic number for AFL teams this season

item.description: When employees at cloud software giant Salesforce eventually return to their office towers, they may find that the fun is gone from their famously fun-loving workplaces.
item.title: Farewell to gummy bears: Offices get a safety makeover for the COVID-era

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: The young teenager ate four large serves of McDonald's chips and nuggets after his 46-hour ordeal lost in the bush. His mother Penny can't wait to meet the man who rescued her son.
item.title: 'He was waiting to be rescued': Will Callaghan ate Maccas chips, slept well after ordeal

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police allege a number of people were seen throwing petrol on one of the boats at Hope Harbour Marina about 11.15pm on June 2. Five boats were damaged.
item.title: Three charged over Gold Coast marina blaze

item.description: It became clear that travel was more difficult these days as soon as I tried to book a flight.
item.title: Voyage into the unknown: How flying has changed during the pandemic

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Electronics retailer JB Hi-Fi has reinstated and upped its full-year guidance after the coronavirus lockdown prompted a bumper crop of sales.
item.title: JB Hi-Fi hikes guidance after a 20 per cent surge in sales

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Hawthorn coach Alastair Clarkson has warned fans to expect an ugly, dour battle at GMHBA Stadium on Friday night as both the Hawks and Cats look to reignite their seasons with a win.
item.title: O'Meara to miss as Clarkson tips dour affair at the Cattery

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Former league hard man Steve Roach has scoffed at Brisbane's decision to slot lanky winger into the back-row for the clash with Manly.
item.title: Putting winger Oates in back-row not going to work: Roach

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 11, 2020
